description.value:
Rite of the Opened Sky
Rite of Accord • Level 4

Gnosis Cost: 7
Time: 8 hours
Resolution: Gnosis Roll
DC: 16
Participants: One or more Garou
Area: A 1-mile radius centered on the ritual site
Duration: 1 hour
Focus: Open sky and storm offerings (blooded water, ash, breath, bone, song)

Summary

The Rite of the Opened Sky calls a cleansing storm that scours corruption from the air and land.

This Rite does not heal the world — it punishes what clings to it. The storm is visible, audible, and unmistakably supernatural.

Effect

On a successful Gnosis roll, a dark storm cloud forms above the ritual site and moves slowly to cover the affected area. Heavy rain falls across the region for the duration.

Any area within the 1-mile radius that the rain can physically reach is affected by this Rite.

While the storm persists:

  • Wyrm-tainted creatures exposed to the rain take 4d10 radiant damage at the start of each of their turns
  • This damage increases to 6d10 radiant damage at Garou level 17
  • Affected creatures may make a Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn, taking half damage on a success
  • The storm does not discriminate by allegiance — only by corruption

Wyrm-Tainted Creatures
For the purposes of this Rite, the following creature types are considered Wyrm-tainted: Undead (all); Fiends (demons, devils, yugoloths); Aberrations; Cursed lycanthropes (Monster Manual lycanthropes); Creatures explicitly described as corrupted, blighted, or Wyrm-tainted by the Storyteller. Beasts, humanoids, fey, elementals, giants, dragons, and constructs are not affected unless explicitly corrupted.

Additional Effects

  • The storm suppresses Wyrm-tainted environmental effects while it persists
  • The area cannot be used as a focal point for summoning, corruption rituals, or blight-spreading effects
  • The storm provides no cover, concealment, or combat advantage to any creature

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Has no effect underground or indoors
  • Does not affect creatures sheltered from the rain
  • Does not stack with itself
  • The storm ends immediately if magically dispersed by an effect of 8th level or higher

Failure

On a failed Gnosis roll:

  • The Gnosis is spent
  • The storm fails to form
  • Failure does not worsen conditions
